variants.name: Standard Facilitation with Compensatory Strategy
variants.description: Focus on intervention technique and therapeutic approach
variants.structure: Patient facilitated in {{TASK}} with {{INTERVENTION}} to {{GOAL}}. {{TECHNIQUE_DETAIL}}. {{ASSIST_LEVEL}} required for {{SUB_TASK}} 2/2 {{IMPAIRMENT}}. {{OUTCOME}}.

TASK.label: Bathing Task
options: seated bathing tasks on tub bench

GOAL.label: Functional Goal
options: maximize activity tolerance and functional endurance
address limited BLE ROM and reduce fall risk
increase independence to advance task performance

TECHNIQUE_DETAIL.label: Technique Details
options: Seated bathing technique and long-handled sponge instruction provided to address limited BLE ROM and reduce fall risk during transfers
Skilled instruction provided in seated techniques and pacing to conserve energy during UB/LB washing
Skilled demonstration and practice provided for long-handled sponge and grab bar use for safety
Instruction in shower chair positioning and proper body mechanics for transfers
Verbal cues progressed from general to specific for washing/rinsing sequence

SUB_TASK.label: Specific Sub-Task
options: SPT from w/c to shower chair
transfer from w/c to shower chair
washing of LB and perineal area
maintain balance while reaching outside base of support

IMPAIRMENT.label: Impairment/Reason
options: limited ROM restricting functional reach and movement
decreased endurance limiting sustained activity performance

OUTCOME.label: Outcome Statement
options: Therapeutic intervention effective as patient able to wash face and BUE independently, 50% of LB with long-handled sponge after skilled demonstration, indicating good potential for adaptive strategy carryover
Patient able to complete bathing tasks with 2 rest breaks vs continuous max assist at baseline, demonstrating potential for increased independence
Patient able to demonstrate proper technique with setup by close of session, demonstrating functional gains with skilled intervention
Patient able to wash face and BUE independently, indicating good learning potential

variants.name: Task-Specific Activity Focus
variants.description: Focus on specific tasks and positioning

SPECIFIC_ACTIVITY.label: Specific Bathing Activity
options: seated bathing tasks on tub bench

PHYSICAL_REQUIREMENTS.label: Physical Requirements/Setup
options: Mod physical assist required for SPT from w/c to shower chair 2/2 BLE weakness affecting weight-bearing and transfer ability
Required long-handled sponge to access LB and back 2/2 decreased trunk mobility
Hand held assist when ambulating 10 feet with RW to tub
Max assist for transfer from w/c to shower chair 2/2 generalized weakness
Setup with shower chair and grab bars for safety

ASSIST_WITH_MECHANICS.label: Assistance with Body Mechanics
options: Patient able to complete sit<>stand with use of grab bars and min assist. Tactile cues to trunk for improved postural stability once seated
Min assist to maintain balance while reaching outside base of support. Graded cues required for sequencing of washing and rinsing
Mod physical assist to complete leg lift into tub. Seated on shower chair, patient required CGA and tactile cues to wash B feet 2/2 poor balance
CGA for safety with verbal cues for proper weight distribution
Tactile cues to BUE to assist with washing hair

ADDITIONAL_DETAILS.label: Task Completion Details
options: Patient washed face and BUE independently, indicating good learning potential
By close of session, patient able to wash 50% of LB, demonstrating functional gains with skilled intervention
Patient able to complete UB washing independently with verbal cues for sequencing
Patient participated by washing chest and face, demonstrating functional gains with skilled intervention
Patient demonstrated improved safety awareness throughout task

variants.name: Cueing and Sequencing Emphasis
variants.description: Focus on cognitive aspects and cueing progression

CUEING_TYPE.label: Cueing Type
options: verbal cues progressing from general to specific

THERAPEUTIC_PURPOSE.label: Therapeutic Purpose
options: increase independence to advance task performance and reduce assistance requirements

CUEING_DETAILS.label: Cueing Details
options: Verbal cues progressed from general to specific for washing/rinsing sequence
Graded cues required for sequencing of washing and rinsing
Tactile and verbal cues provided for task initiation and completion
Cueing for proper sequencing and safety checks throughout

ASSIST_LEVEL.label: Assistance Level
options: Min assist to maintain balance while reaching outside base of support

MEASURABLE_OUTCOME.label: Measurable Outcome
options: Graded cues reduced from 8 to 5 by close of session, demonstrating potential for increased independence
By close of session, patient able to wash 50% of LB, demonstrating functional gains with skilled intervention
Patient completed task with 40% reduction in cues needed
Patient demonstrated improved sequencing with only 2 prompts vs 7 at baseline

variants.name: Safety and Mobility Training Focus
variants.description: Focus on safety concerns and fall risk
variants.structure: Patient facilitated in {{TASK}} with safety training for functional mobility during bathing targeting {{SAFETY_GOAL}}. {{INSTRUCTION_DETAILS}}. {{MOBILITY_REQUIREMENTS}}. {{OUTCOME_SAFETY}}.

SAFETY_GOAL.label: Safety Goal
options: fall risk reduction and safe technique development
proper body mechanics and fall prevention

INSTRUCTION_DETAILS.label: Instruction Details
options: Skilled instruction provided in safe transfer technique and proper grab bar use
Instruction in balance preservation strategies and weight shifting
Training in proper body mechanics and fall prevention strategies
Demonstration of safe transfer sequence with equipment

MOBILITY_REQUIREMENTS.label: Mobility/Assist Requirements
options: Hand held assist when ambulating 10 feet with RW to tub. Mod physical assist to complete leg lift into tub 2/2 poor balance increasing fall risk and decreased proprioception
Min assist for sit<>stand from shower chair. CGA for safety during washing 2/2 poor balance
Patient ambulated 15 ft with RW and SBA. Required min assist for transfer 2/2 decreased LUE motor control
CGA throughout task 2/2 fall risk. Patient required grab bars for all transitions

OUTCOME_SAFETY.label: Outcome with Safety Emphasis
options: Patient demonstrated improved safety awareness by session end, demonstrating potential for increased independence
Patient demonstrated 3/3 safety checks independently, suggesting positive response to therapeutic intervention
Patient verbalized understanding of safety precautions and demonstrated proper technique
Patient showed improved awareness of fall risk factors throughout task

variants.name: Technique Training with Body Region Focus
variants.description: Focus on intervention technique and body region
variants.structure: Patient facilitated in {{BODY_REGION}} dressing with {{TECHNIQUE_TYPE}} to {{GOAL}}. {{INSTRUCTION_DETAILS}}. {{ASSIST_LEVEL}} {{REASON}}. {{OUTCOME_COMPARISON}}.

GOAL.label: Functional Goal
options: promote LB dressing independence and safety
advance UB dressing skills and reduce assistance needs
address fine motor deficits and advance dressing independence
promote independence through adaptive strategy development

INSTRUCTION_DETAILS.label: Instruction Details
options: Skilled instruction provided in seated pants donning and sock aid proper use
Instruction in affected arm first technique for pullover shirt management
Instruction and practice provided in button hook proper use technique
Skilled instruction provided in reacher and dressing stick use

ASSIST_LEVEL.label: Assistance Level with Task
options: Min assist to thread B pants over feet using reacher 2/2 hip precautions
Mod physical assist to manage shirt over head and through affected LUE 2/2 hemiparesis affecting UE coordination
Mod physical assist required for button management 2/2 fine motor deficits limiting manipulation skills
CGA for safety during task 2/2 poor balance

REASON.label: Reason (2/2)
REASON.placeholder: hip precautions, hemiparesis, fine motor deficits, etc.

OUTCOME_COMPARISON.label: Outcome with Baseline Comparison
options: Patient able to pull pants up to hips once in standing with SBA vs mod assist at baseline, demonstrating potential for increased independence
Patient completed task with 40% less assist by session end, demonstrating functional gains with skilled intervention
Patient able to fasten 3 of 5 buttons independently with button hook vs 0/5 at baseline, indicating good learning potential

variants.name: Activity-Specific Positional Dressing
variants.description: Focus on positioning and specific activities

POSITION.label: Position
options: seated on firm surface without back support

ASSIST_WITH_EQUIPMENT.label: Assistance with Equipment
options: Min assist to thread B pants over feet using reacher 2/2 hip precautions. Patient able to pull pants up to hips once in standing
Mod physical assist to manage pullover shirt over head and through affected LUE 2/2 hemiparesis affecting UE coordination. Patient able to thread non-affected RUE with min verbal cues
Mod assist to donn B shoes and socks 2/2 decreased muscle strength and poor fine motor control for tying laces

POSITIONING_CUEING.label: Positioning/Cueing Details
options: Physical assist to complete last 50% of supine to sit sequence. CGA to donn B socks using a sock aid
Tactile cues to scapula to promote protraction during task
Verbal cues for proper body mechanics and sequencing

OUTCOME.label: Outcome Statement
options: demonstrating functional gains with skilled intervention

variants.name: Compensatory Strategy Development
variants.description: Focus on adaptive equipment and strategies
variants.structure: Patient facilitated in {{DRESSING_TASK}} with compensatory technique training to promote independence through adaptive strategy development. {{INSTRUCTION_EQUIPMENT}}. {{ASSIST_IMPLEMENTATION}}. {{OUTCOME_INDEPENDENCE}}.

INSTRUCTION_EQUIPMENT.label: Instruction in Equipment/Techniques
options: Skilled instruction provided in reacher and dressing stick use for donning pants while seated
Instruction in button hook technique for shirt fasteners
Training in sock aid use and proper positioning

OUTCOME_INDEPENDENCE.label: Outcome with Independence Comparison
options: By close of session, patient able to hook belt loops and pull pants over knees independently vs max assist at baseline, indicating good learning potential
Patient completed task with SBA vs mod assist at baseline, demonstrating potential for increased independence
Patient demonstrated proper equipment use with 75% independence vs 25% at baseline

variants.name: Standard Exercise Protocol for ROM
variants.structure: Pt {{ACTION_VERB}} in therapeutic exercise for {{BODY_PART}} {{ROM_TYPE}} to promote {{FUNCTIONAL_GOAL}} 2/2 {{CONDITION}}. {{EXERCISES}} x{{REPS}} x{{SETS}}. {{CUEING}}. {{MEASUREMENT}}.

EXERCISES.label: Exercise List
options: Pulleys, wand exercises, and wall walks
Table slides, wall walks progressing height, seated overhead reach
Supine shoulder flexion, side-lying external rotation, and seated table slides
Passive elevation, external rotation, AAROM with pulley assist

CUEING.label: Cueing Provided
options: Min verbal cues for proper scapular stabilization
Verbal cues for proper breathing and scapular control
Tactile cues at scapula for stability
Setup assist for positioning and verbal cues for proper breathing

MEASUREMENT.label: ROM Measurements
MEASUREMENT.placeholder: PROM shoulder flexion 115 degrees, AROM 95 degrees

variants.name: Post-Surgical ROM Progression
variants.structure: Pt completed therapeutic exercise for {{BODY_PART}} {{ROM_TYPE}} in {{POSITION}} to promote {{GOAL}} 2/2 {{SURGICAL_HISTORY}}. {{TECHNIQUES}}. {{CUEING_PRECAUTIONS}}. Current {{MEASUREMENTS}}.

TECHNIQUES.label: Techniques with Parameters
options: Passive elevation to 105 degrees, external rotation to 30 degrees in scapular plane, AAROM with pulley assist x12 reps x2 sets
Pendulum exercises, passive flexion, and assisted elevation with pulley system x12 reps x2 sets
Supine passive flexion, AAROM with cane assist, progressive wall climbing x8 reps x3 sets

CUEING_PRECAUTIONS.label: Cueing with Precautions
options: Mod verbal cues for pain management and avoiding active muscle contraction
Mod verbal cues for pain management and avoiding compensatory trunk movement
Tactile cues for proper mechanics, verbal cues to avoid compensatory patterns

MEASUREMENTS.label: Current Measurements
MEASUREMENTS.placeholder: L shoulder PROM 105 degrees, pain 3/10 with PROM

variants.name: Functional ROM Training
variants.description: Focus on functional activities and progression
variants.structure: Pt {{ACTION_VERB}} in therapeutic exercise for {{BODY_PART}} ROM to promote {{FUNCTIONAL_TASK}} 2/2 {{CONDITION}}. {{FUNCTIONAL_EXERCISES}}. {{CUEING_QUALITY}}. {{ROM_IMPROVEMENT}}.

FUNCTIONAL_EXERCISES.label: Functional Exercise Progression
options: Supine passive flexion, AAROM with cane assist, progressive wall climbing x8 reps x3 sets
Passive stretching, active-assistive flexion/abduction, and progressive wall walking x8 reps x3 sets
Functional reaching activities, overhead placement tasks, simulated ADL movements x10 reps x3 sets

CUEING_QUALITY.label: Cueing for Quality
options: Tactile cues at scapula for stability, min verbal cues for progression
Verbal cues for proper mechanics and avoiding compensatory patterns
Min verbal cues for scapular control and proper body alignment

ROM_IMPROVEMENT.label: ROM Improvement with Baseline
ROM_IMPROVEMENT.placeholder: PROM improved to 120 degrees, AROM 100 degrees
